TopicTitle: An in-depth guide to plane design with FAR and how to manipulate the partials?

Articles.Content: Is there such a thing yet built? I've read many basic aircraft design threads, many of which were very good as starting points. However, I've not seen anything specifically addressing the questions of "here is this partial derivative on the FAR static stability analysis, and if it's red, here's what you're looking to fix and some ways to fix it." Right now I'm doing things by sloppy imitation and trial and error, but since I don't even know what I'm looking for, it is becoming frustrating.

Yeah, I tried to find that a long time ago, basically ferram4 told me if I didn't ask which one I wanted info on he wouldn't provide it, asking for info on all of them in general didn't work. Then ferram4 released NEAR and I never looked back. Really you can completely ignore that screen, you don't need it, or any of the GUI for FAR at all. Just follow the criteria in this guide and it should be fine.
